message.content:
Search for information about Google's Gemini CLI tool. The user has Gemini Ultra and wants to know:

1. Is there an official Gemini CLI from Google?
2. How to install it
3. How to authenticate/configure it (especially with Gemini Ultra subscription)
4. Can it be used with MCP servers or Claude Code?

Search the web and provide comprehensive installation instructions.

content.text: I'll search for information about Google's Gemini CLI tool for you.

input.query: Google Gemini command line tool setup configure

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Gemini CLI installation instructions authentication"

Links: [{"title":"GitHub - google-gemini/gemini-cli: An open-source AI agent that brings the power of Gemini directly into your terminal.","url":"https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Hands-on with Gemini CLI | Google Codelabs","url":"https://codelabs.developers.google.com/gemini-cli-hands-on"},{"title":"Gemini CLI Authentication Setup | gemini-cli","url":"https://google-gemini.github.io/gemini-cli/docs/get-started/authentication.html"},{"title":"Get started with Gemini CLI | Gemini CLI","url":"https://geminicli.com/docs/get-started/"},{"title":"Gemini CLI authentication setup | Gemini CLI","url":"https://geminicli.com/docs/get-started/authentication/"},{"title":"Gemini CLI: A Guide With Practical Examples | DataCamp","url":"https://www.datacamp.com/tutorial/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Google Gemini CLI Cheatsheet","url":"https://www.philschmid.de/gemini-cli-cheatsheet"},{"title":"How do I install Gemini CLI?","url":"https://milvus.io/ai-quick-reference/how-do-i-install-gemini-cli"},{"title":"How to Install Gemini CLI on Windows | Complete Guide 2025 | Gemini CLI - Free AI Terminal Assistant","url":"https://www.gemini-cli.blog/docs/install/how-to-install-gemini-cli-on-windows"},{"title":"gemini-cli/docs/get-started/authentication.md at main ¬∑ google-gemini/gemini-cli","url":"https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli/blob/main/docs/get-started/authentication.md"}]

Here's information about Gemini CLI installation and authentication:

## Installation

Installing Gemini CLI requires Node.js version 18 or higher as a prerequisite. Once Node.js is installed, you can install Gemini CLI using npm:

`npm install -g @google/gemini-cli`(no content)Once gemini-cli is installed, type `gemini` in your terminal to access it.

## Authentication Methods

### 1. Login with Google (Recommended for most users)

If you run Gemini CLI on your local machine, the simplest authentication method is logging in with your Google account. This method requires a web browser on a machine that can communicate with the terminal running Gemini CLI.(no content)Select "Login with Google." Gemini CLI opens a login prompt using your web browser. Follow the on-screen instructions. Your credentials will be cached locally for future sessions.(no content)You can use your personal Google account to authenticate when prompted. This will grant you up to 60 model requests per minute and 1,000 model requests per day using Gemini.

### 2. Gemini API Key

If you don't want to authenticate using your Google account, you can use an API key from Google AI Studio. To authenticate and use Gemini CLI with a Gemini API key: Obtain your API key from Google AI Studio. Set the GEMINI_API_KEY environment variable to your key.

```bash
export GEMINI_API_KEY="YOUR_GEMINI_API_KEY"
```

Warning: Treat API keys, especially for services like Gemini, as sensitive credentials. Protect them to prevent unauthorized access and potential misuse of the service under your account.

### 3. Vertex AI (Google Cloud)

To use Gemini CLI with Google Cloud's Vertex AI platform, choose from the following authentication options: Application Default Credentials (ADC) using gcloud.(no content)Consider this authentication method if you have Google Cloud CLI installed. If you have previously set GOOGLE_API_KEY or GEMINI_API_KEY, you must unset them to use ADC.

For service account authentication:
Create a service account and key and download the provided JSON file. Assign the "Vertex AI User" role to the service account. Set the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable to the JSON file's absolute path.

### When You Need a Google Cloud Project

Most individual Google accounts (free and paid) don't require a Google Cloud project for authentication. However, you'll need to set a Google Cloud project when you meet at least one of the following conditions: You are using a company, school, or Google Workspace account. You are using a Gemini Code Assist license from the Google Developer Program.

### Persisting Environment Variables

Use a .env file: Create a .gemini/.env file in your project directory or home directory. Gemini CLI automatically loads variables from the first .env file it finds, searching up from the current directory, then in ~/.gemini/.env or ~/.env. .gemini/.env is recommended.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Installation

Installing Gemini CLI requires Node.js version 18 or higher as a prerequisite. Once Node.js is installed, you can install Gemini CLI using npm:

`npm install -g @google/gemini-cli`(no content)Once gemini-cli is installed, type `gemini` in your terminal to access it.

## Authentication Methods

### 1. Login with Google (Recommended for most users)

If you run Gemini CLI on your local machine, the simplest authentication method is logging in with your Google account. This method requires a web browser on a machine that can communicate with the terminal running Gemini CLI.(no content)Select "Login with Google." Gemini CLI opens a login prompt using your web browser. Follow the on-screen instructions. Your credentials will be cached locally for future sessions.(no content)You can use your personal Google account to authenticate when prompted. This will grant you up to 60 model requests per minute and 1,000 model requests per day using Gemini.

### 2. Gemini API Key

If you don't want to authenticate using your Google account, you can use an API key from Google AI Studio. To authenticate and use Gemini CLI with a Gemini API key: Obtain your API key from Google AI Studio. Set the GEMINI_API_KEY environment variable to your key.


### When You Need a Google Cloud Project

However, you'll need to set a Google Cloud project when you meet at least one of the following conditions: You are using a company, school, or Google Workspace account. You are using a Gemini Code Assist license from the Google Developer Program.

Use a .env file: Create a .gemini/.env file in your project directory or home directory. Gemini CLI automatically loads variables from the first .env file it finds, searching up from the current directory, then in ~/.gemini/.env or ~/.env. .gemini/.env is recommended.

Links: [{"title":"Google announces Gemini CLI: your open-source AI agent","url":"https://blog.google/technology/developers/introducing-gemini-cli-open-source-ai-agent/"},{"title":"GitHub - google-gemini/gemini-cli: An open-source AI agent that brings the power of Gemini directly into your terminal.","url":"https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Gemini CLI | Gemini for Google Cloud | Google Cloud Documentation","url":"https://cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Gemini 3 Flash is now available in Gemini CLI - Google Developers Blog","url":"https://developers.googleblog.com/gemini-3-flash-is-now-available-in-gemini-cli/"},{"title":"Releases ¬∑ google-gemini/gemini-cli","url":"https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli/releases"},{"title":"Build, debug & deploy with AI | Gemini CLI","url":"https://geminicli.com/"},{"title":"5 things to try with Gemini 3 Pro in Gemini CLI - Google Developers Blog","url":"https://developers.googleblog.com/en/5-things-to-try-with-gemini-3-pro-in-gemini-cli/"},{"title":"Gemini CLI | Gemini Code Assist | Google for Developers","url":"https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Gemini CLI release notes | Gemini CLI","url":"https://geminicli.com/docs/changelogs/"},{"title":"Gemini CLI extensions let you customize your command line","url":"https://blog.google/technology/developers/gemini-cli-extensions/"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about Google's official Gemini CLI tool in 2025:

## Google Gemini CLI

Gemini CLI is a free and open-source tool that brings Gemini directly into developers' terminals.(no content)It was announced on June 25, 2025.

### Key Features

The tool provides access to Gemini 2.5 Pro with a 1M token context window, built-in tools including Google Search grounding, file operations, shell commands, and web fetching, plus it's extensible through MCP (Model Context Protocol) support for custom integrations.(no content)The Gemini CLI uses a reason and act (ReAct) loop with built-in tools and local or remote MCP servers to complete complex use cases like fixing bugs, creating new features, and improving test coverage.

### Installation

You can install it via npm: `npm install -g @google/gemini-cli`

### Access and Pricing

You can access Gemini 2.5 Pro for free with a personal Google account, or use a Google AI Studio or Vertex AI key for more access.

### Recent Updates

As of December 17, 2025, Gemini 3 Flash is now available in Gemini CLI, supporting high-frequency workflows common to terminal-based work. Gemini 3 Flash achieves a SWE-bench Verified score of 78% for agentic coding.(no content)In November 2025, Google integrated Gemini 3 Pro, their most intelligent model, directly into Gemini CLI to unlock a new level of performance and productivity in the terminal.

### Extensions

In just three months since launch, more than one million developers are building with Gemini CLI.(no content)Gemini CLI extensions is a framework that allows you to customize Gemini CLI and connect it to tools you use most.

### Official Resources
- GitHub: https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli
- Website: https://geminicli.com/
- Google Cloud Docs: https://cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/gemini-cli


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Web search results for query: "Google Gemini command line tool setup configure"

Links: [{"title":"GitHub - google-gemini/gemini-cli: An open-source AI agent that brings the power of Gemini directly into your terminal.","url":"https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Gemini CLI | Gemini for Google Cloud | Google Cloud Documentation","url":"https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Hands-on with Gemini CLI | Google Codelabs","url":"https://codelabs.developers.google.com/gemini-cli-hands-on"},{"title":"Google Gemini CLI Cheatsheet","url":"https://www.philschmid.de/gemini-cli-cheatsheet"},{"title":"Getting Started with Gemini CLI: Run Google Gemini AI in Your Terminal (Quick Setup Guide) | by Vetriselvan Panneerselvam | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@vetriselvan_11/getting-started-with-gemini-cli-use-google-gemini-right-from-your-terminal-326bf5ddd4a4"},{"title":"Google Gemini CLI Tutorial: How to Install and Use It (With Images) - DEV Community","url":"https://dev.to/auden/google-gemini-cli-tutorial-how-to-install-and-use-it-with-images-4phb"},{"title":"Get started with Gemini CLI | Gemini CLI","url":"https://geminicli.com/docs/get-started/"},{"title":"Gemini CLI: A Guide With Practical Examples | DataCamp","url":"https://www.datacamp.com/tutorial/gemini-cli"},{"title":"GitHub - reugn/gemini-cli: A command-line interface (CLI) for Google Gemini","url":"https://github.com/reugn/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Google announces Gemini CLI: your open-source AI agent","url":"https://blog.google/technology/developers/introducing-gemini-cli-open-source-ai-agent/"}]

Here's what I found about setting up and configuring the Google Gemini command line tool:

## Google Gemini CLI Overview

Gemini CLI is an open-source AI agent that brings the power of Gemini directly into your terminal.(no content)The Gemini CLI uses a reason and act (ReAct) loop with your built-in tools and local or remote MCP servers to complete complex use cases like fixing bugs, creating new features, and improving test coverage.

## Installation

Make sure you have Node.js v18 or higher installed on your system.(no content)Once Node.js and npm are installed and verified, install Gemini CLI by running the command in your terminal. Once gemini-cli is installed, type `gemini` in your terminal to access it.

## Authentication Setup

There are several ways to configure authentication:

### Option 1: Login with Google
Choose a login method. "Login with Google" allows up to 60 requests/minute and 1,000 requests/day for free.

### Option 2: API Key via Environment Variable
Get your API key from Google AI Studio. Set your key by using the GEMINI_API_KEY environment variable. To use it across terminal sessions, add this line to your shell's profile (e.g., ~/.bashrc, ~/.zshrc).

### Option 3: Environment File
Create a .env file in ~/.gemini/ for global use or ./.gemini/ for a specific project. The CLI automatically loads it.

### Option 4: Vertex AI
You can set `GOOGLE_API_KEY` and `GOOGLE_GENAI_USE_VERTEXAI=true` for Vertex AI authentication.

## Configuration Options

Gemini CLI offers several ways to configure its behavior, including environment variables, command-line arguments, and settings files.

### Custom Commands
Create custom commands using TOML files. Store them in ~/.gemini/commands/ (global) or \<project\>/.gemini/commands/ (project-specific).

### Extensions
Place extensions in \<workspace\>/.gemini/extensions/ or ~/.gemini/extensions/. Each extension is a directory with a gemini-extension.json file that can configure MCP servers, tools, and context files.

### MCP Server Integration
Manage servers via settings.json or with the `gemini mcp <add|list|remove>` commands.

## Key Features

Gemini CLI provides access to Gemini 2.5 Pro with a 1M token context window, built-in tools including Google Search grounding, file operations, shell commands, and web fetching. It's extensible with MCP (Model Context Protocol) support for custom integrations and is designed for developers who live in the command line.

## Getting Help

A quick way to understand Gemini CLI and the various commands that it supports is to type `/help` (forward slash) and you will see a variety of commands and keyboard shortcuts.(no content)To get a full list of options, you can use `--help`.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Google Gemini CLI Overview

Gemini CLI is an open-source AI agent that brings the power of Gemini directly into your terminal.(no content)The Gemini CLI uses a reason and act (ReAct) loop with your built-in tools and local or remote MCP servers to complete complex use cases like fixing bugs, creating new features, and improving test coverage.

## Installation

## Authentication Setup

There are several ways to configure authentication:

### Option 1: Login with Google
Choose a login method. "Login with Google" allows up to 60 requests/minute and 1,000 requests/day for free.

### Option 2: API Key via Environment Variable
Get your API key from Google AI Studio. Set your key by using the GEMINI_API_KEY environment variable. To use it across terminal sessions, add this line to your shell's profile (e.g., ~/.bashrc, ~/.zshrc).

### Option 4: Vertex AI
You can set `GOOGLE_API_KEY` and `GOOGLE_GENAI_USE_VERTEXAI=true` for Vertex AI authentication.

## Configuration Options

Gemini CLI offers several ways to configure its behavior, including environment variables, command-line arguments, and settings files.

### Custom Commands
Create custom commands using TOML files. Store them in ~/.gemini/commands/ (global) or \<project\>/.gemini/commands/ (project-specific).

### Extensions

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Gemini CLI MCP servers integration"

Links: [{"title":"MCP servers with the Gemini CLI | Gemini CLI","url":"https://geminicli.com/docs/tools/mcp-server/"},{"title":"Gemini CLI ü§ù FastMCP: Simplifying MCP server development - Google Developers Blog","url":"https://developers.googleblog.com/gemini-cli-fastmcp-simplifying-mcp-server-development/"},{"title":"How to Build an MCP Server with Gemini CLI and Go | Google Codelabs","url":"https://codelabs.developers.google.com/cloud-gemini-cli-mcp-go"},{"title":"Set Up Gemini CLI for MCP: GitHub MCP Server | Docker","url":"https://www.docker.com/blog/how-to-set-up-gemini-cli-with-mcp-toolkit/"},{"title":"Gemini CLI Tutorial Series ‚Äî Part 5 : GitHub MCP Server | by Romin Irani | Google Cloud - Community | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/google-cloud/gemini-cli-tutorial-series-part-5-github-mcp-server-b557ae449e6e"},{"title":"MCP servers with the Gemini CLI | Gemini CLI Docs","url":"https://gemini-cli.xyz/docs/en/tools/mcp-server"},{"title":"Gemini CLI ü§ù FastMCP - FastMCP","url":"https://gofastmcp.com/integrations/gemini-cli"},{"title":"Gemini CLI | Awesome MCP Servers","url":"https://mcpservers.org/servers/DiversioTeam/gemini-cli-mcp"},{"title":"Gemini CLI Tutorial Series ‚Äî Part 6 : More MCP Servers | by Romin Irani | Google Cloud - Community | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/google-cloud/gemini-cli-tutorial-series-part-6-more-mcp-servers-91422cadaa35"},{"title":"GitHub - google-gemini/gemini-cli: An open-source AI agent that brings the power of Gemini directly into your terminal.","url":"https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli"}]

Here are the search results for **Gemini CLI MCP servers integration**:

## Overview

With an MCP server, you can extend the Gemini CLI's capabilities to perform actions beyond its built-in features, such as interacting with databases, APIs, custom scripts, or specialized workflows.

## Core Integration Architecture

The Gemini CLI integrates with MCP servers through a sophisticated discovery and execution system. The discovery process is orchestrated by `discoverMcpTools()`, which iterates through configured servers from your `settings.json` mcpServers configuration, establishes connections using appropriate transport mechanisms (Stdio, SSE, or Streamable HTTP), fetches tool definitions from each server using the MCP protocol, and sanitizes and validates tool schemas for compatibility with the Gemini API.

## Configuration

The Gemini CLI uses the mcpServers configuration in your settings.json file to locate and connect to MCP servers. This configuration supports multiple servers with different transport mechanisms.(no content)Configure MCP servers in `~/.gemini/settings.json` to extend Gemini CLI with custom tools, for example:
- `@github List my open pull requests`
- `@slack Send a summary of today's commits to #dev channel`
- `@database Run a query to find inactive users`

## Transport Methods

Gemini CLI supports MCP servers through multiple transport methods including STDIO, SSE, and HTTP, allowing you to extend Gemini's capabilities with custom tools, resources, and prompts from your MCP servers.

## FastMCP Integration

Gemini CLI now seamlessly integrates with FastMCP, Python's leading library for building MCP servers.(no content)As of FastMCP v2.12.3, you can now install local STDIO transport MCP servers built with FastMCP using the `fastmcp install gemini-cli` command.(no content)Tools allow Gemini CLI to perform actions, computations, or interact with external APIs and databases. Prompts can be used as slash commands within Gemini CLI (e.g., `/promptname`). This streamlines interactions and makes commonly used prompts feel native to your terminal environment.

## MCP Resources Support

Some MCP servers expose contextual "resources" in addition to the tools and prompts. Gemini CLI discovers these automatically and gives you the possibility to reference them in the chat.(no content)You can use the same `@` syntax already known for referencing local files. Resource URIs appear in the completion menu together with filesystem paths.

## OAuth Support for Remote Servers

The Gemini CLI supports OAuth 2.0 authentication for remote MCP servers using SSE or HTTP transports. This enables secure access to MCP servers that require authentication.

## Available MCP Server Examples

According to various tutorials, Gemini CLI can integrate with:
- The Github official MCP Server provides sufficient documentation on the tools that it exposes along with how to configure the same.
- Firebase MCP Server has a dependence on the Firebase CLI, so you need to have it available locally since you must authenticate with the CLI before using the MCP Server.
- Docker Desktop automatically configures the MCP Gateway connection ‚Äì the underlying infrastructure that routes requests between Gemini CLI and your MCP servers, handling authentication, containerisation, and secure communication seamlessly.

## Building Custom MCP Servers

You can build and deploy a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server to extend the capabilities of Gemini CLI. For example, you could build a Go-based server that provides custom tools for Go development, transforming Gemini CLI from a general-purpose coding assistant into a specialized development expert.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Available MCP Server Examples

According to various tutorials, Gemini CLI can integrate with:
- The Github official MCP Server provides sufficient documentation on the tools that it exposes along with how to configure the same.
- Firebase MCP Server has a dependence on the Firebase CLI, so you need to have it available locally since you must authenticate with the CLI before using the MCP Server.
- Docker Desktop automatically configures the MCP Gateway connection ‚Äì the underlying infrastructure that routes requests between Gemini CLI and your MCP servers, handling authentication, containerisation, and secure communication seamlessly.

## Building Custom MCP Servers

You can build and deploy a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server to extend the capabilities of Gemini CLI. For example, you could build a Go-based server that provides custom tools for Go development, transforming Gemini CLI from a general-purpose coding assistant into a specialized development expert.

content.text:
Based on my research, here's comprehensive information about Google's Gemini CLI tool:

## 1. Is There an Official Gemini CLI from Google?

**Yes**, Google released an official, open-source Gemini CLI tool. It was announced in June 2025 and has already reached over one million developers using it within three months of launch.

## 2. Installation Instructions

### Prerequisites
- Node.js v18 or higher

### Install Gemini CLI
```bash
npm install -g @google/gemini-cli
```

Once installed, launch it by typing:
```bash
gemini
```

## 3. Authentication & Configuration

Gemini CLI supports multiple authentication methods:

### Option A: Login with Google (Recommended)
- Run `gemini` and select "Login with Google"
- Follow browser prompts to authenticate with your personal Google account
- Credentials are cached locally for future sessions
- **Rate limits**: 60 requests/minute, 1,000 requests/day

### Option B: Gemini API Key
Get an API key from [Google AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com) and set it:
```bash
export GEMINI_API_KEY="YOUR_GEMINI_API_KEY"
```

To persist across sessions, add to `~/.gemini/.env`:
```
GEMINI_API_KEY=your_key_here
```

### Option C: Vertex AI (Google Cloud)
For Google Cloud projects:
```bash
export GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS="/path/to/service-account-key.json"
export GOOGLE_GENAI_USE_VERTEXAI=true
```

### Configuration Files
Gemini CLI automatically loads environment variables from:
1. `.gemini/.env` (project-specific, recommended)
2. `~/.gemini/.env` (user home directory)
3. `~/.env` (system-wide)

## 4. MCP Server Integration & Claude Code Compatibility

**Yes, Gemini CLI fully supports MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers.**

### MCP Configuration
Configure MCP servers in `~/.gemini/settings.json`:
```json
{
  "mcpServers": [
    {
      "name": "github",
      "type": "stdio",
      "command": "path/to/mcp/server"
    }
  ]
}
```

Or use the CLI command:
```bash
gemini mcp add <server-name> <transport> <details>
gemini mcp list
gemini mcp remove <server-name>
```

### Transport Methods Supported
- **STDIO**: Local MCP servers
- **SSE (Server-Sent Events)**: Remote servers
- **HTTP**: Web-based servers
- **OAuth 2.0**: For servers requiring authentication

### Using MCP Resources in Gemini CLI
Once configured, reference MCP tools using `@` syntax:
```
@github List my open pull requests
@slack Send a summary of today's commits to #dev
@database Run a query to find inactive users
```

### FastMCP Integration
Gemini CLI integrates with [FastMCP](https://gofastmcp.com/), Python's leading MCP library. Install MCP servers using:
```bash
fastmcp install gemini-cli
```

### Regarding Claude Code
Gemini CLI and Claude Code are separate tools from different companies (Google vs. Anthropic). They're not directly compatible with each other. However, **both support MCP servers**, so you could potentially use the same MCP servers with either tool independently.

## 5. Model Access

Gemini CLI provides access to:
- **Gemini 2.5 Pro** (1M token context window)
- **Gemini 3 Pro** (as of November 2025)
- **Gemini 3 Flash** (as of December 2025)

### Built-in Tools
- Google Search grounding
- File operations
- Shell command execution
- Web fetching
- Extensible via MCP

## Official Resources

- [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli)
- [Gemini CLI Official Site](https://geminicli.com/)
- [Authentication Setup Guide](https://geminicli.com/docs/get-started/authentication/)
- [MCP Server Integration Guide](https://geminicli.com/docs/tools/mcp-server/)
- [Google Cloud Documentation](https://cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/gemini-cli)

Sources:
- [Google announces Gemini CLI](https://blog.google/technology/developers/introducing-gemini-cli-open-source-ai-agent/)
- [Official GitHub Repository](https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli)
- [Get Started with Gemini CLI](https://geminicli.com/docs/get-started/)
- [Authentication Documentation](https://geminicli.com/docs/get-started/authentication/)
- [MCP Servers with Gemini CLI](https://geminicli.com/docs/tools/mcp-server/)
- [Gemini CLI & FastMCP Integration](https://developers.googleblog.com/gemini-cli-fastmcp-simplifying-mcp-server-development/)
